alert.note: Alert for Baker County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:52PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Baker County through 430 PM PDT... At 352 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Anthony Lakes Ski Area to near Flagstaff Hill. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Flagstaff Hill around 400 PM PDT. Keating around 410 PM PDT. North Powder around 420 PM PDT. Gover Reservoir, Tamarack Campground and Thief Valley Reservoir around 430 PM PDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM PDT for northeastern Oregon.
